==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* {{Fr|Belleau}} is a portmanteau of the French words {{Fr|belle|beautiful}} and {{Fr|eau|water.}}
** The region shares its name with the commune of {{w|Belleau, Aisne|Belleau}} in northern France. The commune was involved in the {{w|Battle of Belleau Wood}}, a major historic battle in World War I.

* It's more probable that the name {{Fr|Belleau}} derives from {{w|Fontainebleau}}, a commune southeast of Paris renowned for its historical château and forest. In Chinese, {{Fr|Fontainebleau}} is translated as {{zh|枫丹白露|Fēngdān Báilù}} by renowned Chinese poet and essayist {{w|Zhu Ziqing}}<ref>Chinese Wikipedia: [https://zh.wikipedia.org/zh-cn/%E6%9E%AB%E4%B8%B9%E7%99%BD%E9%9C%B2#%E5%9C%B0%E5%90%8D%E6%9D%A5%E6%BA%90 {{zh|枫丹白露}}]</ref>, where {{zh|枫丹|Fēngdān}} corresponds to "{{Fr|Fontaine}}" and {{zh|白露|Báilù}} to "{{Fr|Belleau}}." This translation suggests a significant link between the names in the game and the real-world location. While the English representation of {{Fr|Belleau}} does not directly reflect the latter part of {{Fr|Fontainebleau}}, the phonetic similarity and exact match in the Chinese translation could indicate an intentional reference.
